{"id":1281715432,"question_id":3413,"lang":"python3","lang_name":"Python3","time":"1 month, 1 week","timestamp":1717859239,"status":10,"status_display":"Accepted","runtime":"5373 ms","url":"/submissions/detail/1281715432/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Find The First Player to win K Games in a Row","memory":"38.6 MB","code":"class Solution:\n    def findWinningPlayer(self, skills: List[int], k: int) -> int:\n        mp = {skills[i]: i for i in range(len(skills))}\n        count = 0\n        mx = max(skills)\n        if k > len(skills):\n            return mp[mx]\n        prev = -1\n        while count < k:\n            p1, p2 = skills[0], skills[1]\n            # print(skills, count, prev)\n            if p1==mx or p2==mx:\n                return mp[mx]\n\n            if p1 > p2:\n                skills.append(skills.pop(1))\n                if prev == p1:\n                    count+=1\n                else:\n                    count=1\n                    prev = p1\n            else:\n                skills.append(skills.pop(0))\n                if prev == p2:\n                    count+=1\n                else:\n                    count=1\n                    prev = p2\n            \n        \n        return mp[skills[0]]\n","compare_result":"","title_slug":"find-the-first-player-to-win-k-games-in-a-row","has_notes":false,"flag_type":1}
